title: Reports page shows `oops` error after reopening the App

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem 1. User is on the Reports page and backgrounds the App 2. After a while (maybe a full 15min), user reopens the App 3. User sees the Oops error page ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abe8a3f8-4b9f-4a65-9276-276b4d65c363) ### Solution Logs show the following: ``` Got an authorization error Expensify\Error\Auth\AuthTokenExpired - 9b953676-e64d-4262-bf74-1bf0ff888e4d ~~ command: 'Search' exceptionJsonCode: '407' exceptionUserMessage: 'Your session has expired. Please sign in again.' ``` The auth token is probably expiring and we're sending a request to Search before we re-authenticate the user, which leads to the request failing and the error showing. Make sure we re-authenticate first.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.67-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75831 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** iPhone 16 pro/26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: Owner creates a workspace and invite member and approver 1. Open app 2. Employee submits expense in workspace chat 3. Employee goes offline 4. Approver at other device approves the expense 5. Employee retract and delete the expense 6. Employee goes back online 7. Employee taps on the expense 8. Employee taps on X button of error message 9. Employee scroll down to the end and tap on X button of error message 10. Employee tap back button for return to report preview ## Expected Result: Report preview should display without error ## Actual Result: Red dot is displayed on the report preview ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4b51e289-3aa6-4ab2-bcaa-d4160bc4c38d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.67-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2248/folder/13176710/41236945/1050638404 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Android **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. title: [$250] Update unnamed workspaces with Company name from accounting integrations

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Proposal: Update unnamed workspaces with Company name from accounting integrations. Problem: when users are interacting with the product, if the workspace doesn’t have a customized name, then it becomes more confusing to users what the workspace is meant to do. Solution: If an admin has the default/unnamed workspace AND is connecting to an accounting package where the Company name is sent to us, update the workspace name. 1. Release 1: Update accounting integrations so we automatically change the name of workspace name where the user has not changed the default. 2. Release 2: Send a system message from Concierge "I updated your workspace name to match the company name from your accounting connection.” Coming from this thread: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1764109833503519?thread_ts=1762875210.606739&cid=C07HPDRELLD
